pullRequest.title: Issue 4964: Prevent a busy loop while waiting for the segments to be updated
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: Tom Kaitchuck tom.kaitchuck@emc.com
Change log description
Prevent a busy loop while waiting for the segments to be updated
Purpose of the change
Fixes #4964
What the code does
Adds a sleep in flush in the event that a segment is sealed and being processed by a background thread. This is optimized somewhat by using it's lock if the process has already begun.
How to verify it
We should run system tests on this PR before merging.

Issue 5454: Fixing Segment Store flaky tests and other bugs (#5472)

- Fixing various unit tests in the Segment Store package(s) that caused builds to randomly fail.
- Fixed a bug in BlockingDrainingQueue that would have resulted in data loss if a TimeoutException preempted the completion of a timeout-eligible take future (#5516).
- Fixed a bug in OperationProcessor error handler to initiate the service shutdown in an async manner (to avoid deadlocks)
- Fixed a bug in OperationProcessor to "unaccount" for the cache effects of operations that are in flight but have failed to be committed due to the service shutting down (byte accounting leak).
- Fixed a bug in StreamSegmentReadIndex that would have caused a ReadResult to hang if certain concurrency conditions occur (merging a source segment into a parent one at the same time as either issuing the ReadResultEntry or completing it).
- Fixed a bug in RedirectedReadIndexEntry that would throw an UnsupportedOperationException when attempting to close. This is invoked when a ReadResult is cancelled/cleaned up (so if it's sitting on one of those entries, the operation would fail).
- Fixed a bug in StreamSegmentContainer that would incorrectly report as "Failed" if it is immediately shut down after startup (i.e., if the secondary services haven't yet been started).

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@emc.com>

    - Has a compile and static analysis job, followed by a few parallel test jobs, then a check and a snapshot (only for master branch and release branches).
    - Check job is called CI Complete.
* Bonus features:
    - Build output is cached after the Build step and reused for subsequent jobs. This speeds up the overall workflow run.

Issue 4956: Fix bugs in list streams and list scope api when resources are filtered (#4957)

Implementation
Signed-off-by: Shivesh Ranjan <shivesh.ranjan@gmail.com>

Change log description
If resources are filtered due to authorization, keep calling list resource api on store until we have collected desired number of results to fill the page or entries are exhausted.

Purpose of the change
Fixes #4956

What the code does
Make recursive call if the resources are filtered out due to authorization until we either collect "limit" number of records or exhaust all entries in the store.
This is performed for both streams and KVT.
KVT already had the implementation but there were bugs in it which are also fixed here.

Also, segment store returns an empty continuation token if we request from the last element and there are no more elements to read. This is handled in PravegaTableStoreHelper to return the caller's token if response from segment store is empty.

Change log description
Replace the cache implementation to not load the completablefuture into the cache as that can cause consistency issues.

Purpose of the change
Fixes #4975

What the code does
Changes the cache to load the value. The store first retrieves the value for mutable records from the cache. and if not found, it calls the store and loads the value from the future.
We dont try to optimize on multiple concurrent invocations to the loading function because that will result in the original problem of consistency check failure.

Issue 5181: Fix Null Pointer Exception in the log message (#5182)

Signed-off-by: Shivesh Ranjan shivesh.ranjan@gmail.com

Change log description
Fixes NPE in StreamMetadataTasks.retention method where we may truncate at an older streamcut despite not producing a "new stream cut".

Purpose of the change
Fixes #5181

What the code does
NPE is caused by a new log message that was introduced recently which logs newRecord instead of truncationRecord. The new record represents the new streamcut which is generated periodically. It is possible that we do not generate a new streamcut in each cycle if the previous cycle was cut short for some reason and a streamcut was generated. The truncation record represents an older streamcut at which we want to truncate.
The intent of the log message is to log the identified truncation streamcut. Instead it ends up logging new streamcut which can be null in some cases.

How to verify it
All tests should pass and there should be no NPE.

Signed-off-by: Tom Kaitchuck <tom.kaitchuck@emc.com>

Issue 5111: Consumption based retention policy implementation (#5289)

Signed-off-by: Shivesh Ranjan <shivesh.ranjan@gmail.com>

## Change log description
Implements consumption based retention policy.

This does two things primarily -
In Stream Metadata Tasks it consolidates and computes lower bound on subscriber streamcuts and truncates at the said stream cut. This also applies time/size bounds
In stream cut validation in stream metadata store, we assumed stream cuts to be made of non overlapping segments, but a stream cut could have future segments which may not have been read from. These are represented using "-1" as the offset. So we update the logic in stream metadata store for validation as well as size computations for streamcuts.

Signed-off-by: Tom Kaitchuck <tom.kaitchuck@emc.com>
